title: mRemoteNG crashes if panel containing connection(s) is closed
author: C4rb0n
body_snippet:
<!--- Provide a general summary of the issue in the Title above -->
When connections belonging to more than one panel are open (thus making the panel tabs appear), if a panel is closed, by clicking the "X" or right-clicking and choosing "X Close" on the panel tab itself, mRemoteNG crashes with the following exception:

   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.MarshaledInvoke(Control caller, Delegate method, Object[] args, Boolean synchronous)
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.Invoke(Delegate meth...

comments.snippet: This could be related to #2118, just caused manually and not when closing the Window itself...
comments.author: simonai1254

comments.snippet:
I guess the problem is with connections that require Putty (Telnet, SSH etc.). Tried with RDP, VNC, Telnet and SSH connections and only the latter two are causing crash. Exception is the same:

```
Exception Message
"Cannot access a disposed object.
Object name: 'ConnectionWindow'."

Stack trace
   at System.Windows.Forms.Control.MarshaledInvoke(Control caller, Delegate method, Object[] args, Boolean synchronous)
